mention.text: `` ABUJA -LRB- Reuters -RRB- - Nigeria 's government signaled willingness on Tuesday to negotiate with Islamist militants holding more than 200 schoolgirls , a month after the kidnap that has provoked global outrage .
Nigeria 's government signaled willingness on Tuesday to negotiate with Islamist militants holding more than 200 schoolgirls , a month after the kidnap that has provoked global outrage
Minister of Special Duties Tanimu Turaki told Reuters by telephone
Shekau , who sat in front of a green backdrop holding an AK-47 during part of the video
more than 110 girls sitting on the ground in a rural location , the first time they have been seen in captivity
the first time they have been seen in captivity
a sparsely populated region near the borders with Cameroon , Niger and Chad
emergency in the northeastern states of Adamawa , Borno and Yobe
Washington , Writing by Matthew Mpoke Bigg , Editing by Mark Trevelyan and Janet Lawrence -RRB-
a leader at the girls ' boarding school
fellow students and girls who escaped the abductions
